abstract: While cloud computing is beginning to take off in Asia, its adoption is being hampered by regulations governing where data is stored, concerns about security and poor internet connections.
snippet: While cloud computing is beginning to take off in Asia, its adoption is being hampered by regulations governing where data is stored, concerns about security and poor internet connections.
lead_paragraph: SINGAPORE — The Youth Olympic Games here in August presented organizers with a formidable, but temporary, computing hurdle: Manage 3,600 athletes, 20,000 volunteers and 370,000 spectators for two weeks.

headline.main: Regulations and Security Concerns Hinder Asia’s Move to Cloud Computing
headline.print_headline: Cloud Computing Grows in Asia, Despite Political and Technical Hurdles

keywords.name: glocations
keywords.value: Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas
